headline.main: Hopes of Holding Australia for Offensive Voiced by Connally After Hart Testifies

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 2 -- Senator Tom Connally of Texas said today that on the basis of information given the Foreign Relations Committee, of which he is chairman, by Vice Admiral Thomas C. Hart during the day he was encouraged to believe that the United Nations forces were sufficiently strong to hold Australia as a base for future offensive action against the Japanese.
abstract: Sen Connally repts Adm Hart testimony to Sen Foreign Relations Com supports belief Australia can be held as base for future offensive
